help.title: 777-200ER
help.text:
=== Tutorials === Interactive tutorials are available to introduce you to this aircraft and its cockpit instruments. See main menu: "Help" - "Tutorials".
=== Takeoff Procedure === Pre-departure: 1. - Allocate your fuel, passengers and weight under Equipment/fuel and payload - Ensure a complete systems checklist is carried out - Use Pushback truck to taxi away from the terminal
Departure: 2. Select 777-200ER/Autostart (or press 's') to get the engines running 3. Set your flaps suitably for the conditions and runway length 4. Release parking brakes 5. Apply throttle gently, until at 75% throttle 6. Rotate at around 140-160kt 7. Raise landing gear at positive climb 8. Maintain positive climb
=== Cruising === Cruising Speed: Mach 0.84 (905 km/h, 490 knots, 560 mph) at 35,000 ft Service Ceiling: 43,100ft
=== Landing === 1. Arm auto speedbrakes and suitable autobrake level (or decide to operate manually) 2. Switch off cabin lights. Switch on landing lights if necessary 3. Decend through 200kt, reaching roughly 160kt 1mile before reaching the apron 4. Set flaps accordingly 5. Land at roughly 140kt, touch down carefully and smoothly at 135kt 6. Apply speedbrakes (when operating manually) 7. Apply thrust reversal and apply throttle 8. Lower throttle and deactivate thrust reversers 9. If necessary, emergency brakes should be used (avoid overheating the brakes)
